MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
***This report contains sexually explicit information***
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
Special Investigation #: 2025SIC0000826
Special Investigation Intake Date: June 30, 2025
License #: CI410201226

Agency Name: KENTWOOD CAMPUS

GRAND RAPIDS, MI 49512-8193
License Status: Regular
License Expiration Date: 03/01/2027
Capacity: 36

1

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4126
Section Sufficiency of staff.
Description (1) The licensee shall have a sufficient number of administrative,
supervisory, social service, direct care, and other staff on duty to
perform the prescribed functions required by these administrative
rules and in the agency's program statement and to provide for the
continual needs, protection, and supervision of residents
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On 6/29/25, a youth was using the bathroom and opened the
door, allowing another youth to enter. Staff became aware and
intervened. There were reports of sexual contact with one
another. The youth are restricted from their opposing hallways.
Investigation Interviews:
Manager was interviewed via phone on June 30, 2025.
Manager reported she was notified by Supervisor of these
reported allegations. She reported Staff 1 was allowing Youth A
into the bathroom when the office phone was ringing. Manager
reported Staff 1 went to answer the phone and that was when
Youth A allowed Youth B into the bathroom. She reported she is
unaware of how staff found Youth A and Youth B in the bathroom
together. Manager reported Youth A has a sexual safety plan and
Youth B does not at this time. She reported the youth are currently
sleeping in separate hallways and utilizing only the bathrooms in
their hallways as a safety precaution.
Youth A was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 1,
2025, in collaboration with Law Enforcement. Youth A reported
she did not want to talk about the bathroom situation with Youth B.
She reported Youth B encouraged her to set this meeting up in the
bathroom. Youth A reported Youth B just mentioned this to her in
passing since staff were always around and this was during a time
staff were briefly talking to another staff. She would not disclose
further what was said in the conversation with Youth B, or when
this occurred, or what staff were around. Youth A reported she
had to go the bathroom so she asked Staff 1 to let her in as the
area was locked. She reported Youth B then went to her bedroom
while Youth A stayed in the bathroom. Youth A reported Youth B
then knocked on the door and she allowed Youth B into the
bathroom. She reported that within a few minutes, Staff 1 had
knocked on the bathroom to check on her. Youth A reported when
Staff 1 checked on her, she stuck her head out the door and
Youth B hid in the bathroom so Staff 1 could not see her. She
reported after Staff 1 checked on her this made her want to leave
2

the bathroom, so she came out a few minutes later. When asked
what happened in the bathroom, Youth A reported she had kissed
Youth B. She reported they both took down their pants and
touched each other’s vaginas. Youth A reported that it was
consensual, but it was Youth B’s idea. She reported she told Staff
1 and Staff 2 after the situation happened because she felt guilty.
Youth A reported Staff 1 was doing appropriate supervision they
were just able to sneak in when Staff 1 was not looking. She
reported she was in the bathroom with Youth B for less then ten
minutes.
Youth B was interviewed face to face at the facility on July 1,
2025, in collaboration with Law Enforcement. Youth B was
resistant to talk with this consultant and law enforcement. Youth B
continued to ask about getting her moved from the facility because
she wanted to go home. When asked about the incident that
occurred on June 29, 2025, Youth B reported Youth A made her
go into the bathroom with her. She reported they both took off
their pants and touched each other’s vaginas. Youth B explained
that Youth A told her to go to her bedroom when Youth A was in
the bathroom so that she could sneak into the bathroom together.
She reported that Staff 1 was watching the hallway, but she turned
away for a moment, so she went and knocked on the bathroom
door for Youth A to allow her in. Youth B was asked to go into
more detail about what happened, and she refused to talk
anymore. She became upset from the interview and walked out
from the interview.
Law Enforcement was interviewed facility to face at the
facility on July 1, 2025. Law Enforcement reported she will be
closing her case as per the interviews with the youth it appeared
the sexual acts were consensual.
Staff 1 was interviewed via phone on July 2, 2025. Staff 1
reported she started her shift around 7:00pm on June 29, 2025.
She reported when she was in the milieu, Youth B had asked to
go to bed early and then Youth A was jumping around stating she
needed to use the restroom right away. Staff 1 reported she
allowed Youth A into the bathroom due to Youth A expressing it
was an emergency. She reported she also allowed Youth B into
her bedroom at that time. Staff 1 reported Youth B gave her an
mp3 player to charge in the staff office, but she waited in the
hallway for a little bit. She reported she thought Youth A was
going to be fast in the bathroom and she noticed the phone in the
office continued to ring nonstop. Staff 1 thought this was an
emergency so she maintained supervision while she was going
3

into the office through the door window where she could see the
hallway. She reported she turned her back for a moment to
answer the phone. Staff 1 reported when she was on the phone,
she watched the hallway and then went back in to check on Youth
A in the bathroom. She stated Youth A reported she was still using
the bathroom. Staff 1 reported she checked in on Youth A two
times while she was in the bathroom and noted that Youth A was
in the bathroom for about fifteen minutes. She reported she
wanted to make sure she was safe and was doing variable
intervals on both Youth A and Youth B. Staff 1 reported the last
time she checked; Youth A was done using the restroom and
came out. She stated she did not see Youth B in the bathroom at
all. Staff 1 reported she heard from Youth A that Youth B was in
the bathroom with her. She reported she did all the checks she
was supposed to on Youth A and is aware of Youth A’s safety
plan. Staff 1 reported she only had her back turned for a minute or
less.
Staff 2 was interviewed via phone on July 2, 2025. Staff 2
reported on June 29, 2025, he was supervising phone calls with
youth in the staff office. He reported around 7:10pm Youth A had
asked to use the bathroom and Staff 1 allowed her into the
bathroom. Staff 2 reported Youth B then asked moments later to
be let into her bedroom, which is noted to be within the same
hallway. He reported Staff 1 had informed him of the whereabouts
of the youth and he reminded her to maintain supervision of the
hallway due to two youth being down the same hallway. Staff 2
reported he was also aware of Youth A’s safety plan and the need
for supervision. He reported Staff 1 stood in the doorway of the
staff office that faced that hallway to maintain supervision. Staff 2
reported that after about five minutes, Staff 1 did a check-in on
Youth A in the bathroom. He reported that Staff 2 did take a phone
call from the staff office which was less than a minute. Staff 2
reported he did a bathroom check with Staff 1 around 7:25 pm
which Youth A popped her head out saying she was okay, and
they did not see anyone in the bathroom. He reported a little bit
later Youth A and Youth B both told him that they were in the
bathroom together. Staff 2 reported this was when he called
Supervisor. He reported Staff 1 maintained appropriate
supervision and did checks as needed for both Youth A and Youth
B.
Supervisor was interviewed face to face at the facility on July
1, 2025. Supervisor reported she received a phone call from Staff
2 on June 29, 2025, of the reported concerns of Youth A and
Youth B being in the bathroom together. She reported she told
4

him to make sure an incident report was completed, and the youth
are to only use the bathrooms in their own assigned hallways.
Supervisor reported she talked with Manager about the situation
as well. She reported she had not reviewed the video footage of
the incident. Supervisor reported she does not have concerns
about Staff 1 or Staff 2’s ability to supervise the youth.
Video Recording
Video record of June 29, 2025 during the time of 7:10pm to
7:27pm was reviewed at the facility on July 1, 2025, by this
consultant. The video footage is captured within the West
Hallway. Youth A entered the hallway with Staff 1 behind her. Staff
1 opened the bathroom door and checked in the bathroom before
Youth A entered the bathroom. About one minute later, Youth B
entered the hallway with Staff 1 and Staff 1 opened Youth B’s
bedroom door. Staff 1 remained in the hallway monitoring and
during that time Youth B came out of her bedroom to talk with
Staff 1. Around 7:16pm, Staff 1 knocked on the bathroom door to
check on Youth A. About a minute later, Staff 1 entered the staff
office and is seen within the window of the staff office door looking
into the West hallway. Around 7:17pm, Staff 1 is no longer within
the window of the staff office door and Youth B is seen looking out
her door. Youth B then exited her bedroom and knocked on the
bathroom door. Youth A opened the bathroom door and allowed
Youth B into the bathroom. Around 7:18pm it is seen Staff 1 is
back in the window of the door looking into the hallway. Around
7:24pm, Staff 1 knocks on the bathroom door and Staff 1 is seen
talking with Youth A. During this time, Staff 2 is behind Staff 1
monitoring the interaction. About thirty seconds later, Staff 1
stepped back into the staff office and at 7:25pm Youth B opened
the bathroom door, peeked to investigate the hallway and exited
the bathroom. Youth B then exited the hallway back into the
milieu. Youth A exited the bathroom at 7:26pm and went back into
the milieu.
When reviewing compliance for supervision of Youth B within the
video staff were found in compliance. Youth B was let into her
room around 7:11pm by Staff 1. At 7:13pm, Youth B is seen in the
hallway talking to Staff 1 until she goes back into her bedroom at
7:15pm. At 7:16pm, Staff 1 checks both Youth A in the bathroom
and Youth B in her bedroom. At 7:25pm, Youth B enters the milieu
and is seen talking with Staff 2.
5

Documentation Reviewed:
- Youth A’s Safety Plan - This plan was sent out by
Manager to all staff on May 14, 2025. Staff are to not
disclose to Youth A that she is on one-to-one staffing. The
safety plan notes the staff should remain relatively close to
Youth A throughout the shift. Staff should ensure Youth A
will remain two arms lengths away from peers. If Youth A
does not provide that space, staff should encourage,
redirect, and consequent when necessary.
- Facility Incident report dated June 29, 2025, completed
by Staff 2- This incident reports notes Staff 1 allowed
Youth A into the west bathroom. Staff 1 then allowed Youth
B into her bedroom which is also located in the West Hally
way. Staff 1 remained in the Staff Office and kept an eye on
the visual of the West Hallway. A phone call came through
the program at 7:16pm which Staff 1 answered the phone.
During this time Youth A opened the bathroom door to
allow Youth B into the bathroom with her. Youth B later
disclosed to Staff 1 that she had engaged in sexual acts
with Youth A. Staff 2 reported this information to
Supervisor, while Staff 1 spoke with Youth A. Both the
youth went on restrictions to no using any bathroom not
assigned to their bedroom hallways as their bedrooms were
already located on the opposite hallways.
- Facility Policy- Client Safety Procedures- This policy
notes that is a youth is away from the milieu group and not
under direct ongoing staff supervision, staff must visually
observe clients at variable intervals, with no more than
fifteen minutes between checks. Staff should also never
allow youth alone together in a communal space without
direct staff supervision.
- Staff 1 Human Resource File- Staff 1 has no disciplinary
actions noted within her HR file. Staff 1 is up to date on all
required trainings with the most recent training reviewing
supervision requirements during a team meeting on June 3,
2025.
- Staff 2 Human Resource File- Staff 2 has one written
warning noted in his HR from March 28, 2025, due to
documentation concerns. Staff 2 is up to date on all
6

required trainings with the most recent training of reviewing
supervision policy on March 17, 2025.
Analysis The facility is found in compliance as Staff 1 completed two
bathroom checks in less than fifteen minutes of Youth A being in
the bathroom and completed checks on Youth B. Within video
footage and interviews, it was found Youth A and Youth B had this
situation planned and watched to see when staff had their back
turned for a moment. Staff 1 completed her checks when required
and maintained supervision as required and in line with the policy.
Conclusion Violation Not Established
IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. It is recommended that the current license status be
continued.
July 11, 2025
